Proposition D.6 (Convex bound on gradient of overall loss).

If client losses fisubscript𝑓𝑖f_{i} and centralized loss fcsubscript𝑓cf_{\textrm{c}} are each μ𝜇\mu-convex (Definition D.4) and β𝛽\beta-smooth (Definition D.1), and 𝐱∗superscript𝐱\bm{x}^{*} is an optimum of the overall loss f𝑓f (as defined in Equation 1), then the expected norm of the gradient of overall loss is bounded as:

𝔼​‖∇f​(𝒙)‖2≤4​β​𝔼​[f​(𝒙)−f​(𝒙∗)]𝔼superscriptnorm∇𝑓𝒙24𝛽𝔼delimited-[]𝑓𝒙𝑓superscript𝒙\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x})\right\|^{2}\leq 4\beta\mathbb{E}\left[f(\bm{x})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right]
Proof.
𝔼​‖∇f​(𝒙)‖2=𝔼​‖∇f​(𝒙)−∇f​(𝒙∗)‖2=𝔼​‖1N​∑i=1N(∇fi​(𝒙)−∇fi​(𝒙∗))+(∇fc​(𝒙)−∇fc​(𝒙∗))‖2𝔼superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓𝒙2𝔼superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓𝒙∇𝑓superscript𝒙2𝔼superscriptdelimited-∥∥1𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙∇subscript𝑓c𝒙∇subscript𝑓csuperscript𝒙2\begin{split}\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x})\right\|^{2}&=\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{*})\right\|^{2}\\ &=\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\left(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{*})\right)+\left(\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{*})\right)\right\|^{2}\\ \end{split}

Applying the relaxed triangle inequality (Lemma D.2) twice:

𝔼​‖∇f​(𝒙)‖2≤2​𝔼​‖1N​∑i=1N(∇fi​(𝒙)−∇fi​(𝒙∗))‖2+2​𝔼​‖∇fc​(𝒙)−∇fc​(𝒙∗)‖2≤2​𝔼​1N​∑i=1N‖(∇fi​(𝒙)−∇fi​(𝒙∗))‖2+2​𝔼​‖∇fc​(𝒙)−∇fc​(𝒙∗)‖2≤2​𝔼​[1N​∑i=1N‖(∇fi​(𝒙)−∇fi​(𝒙∗))‖2+‖∇fc​(𝒙)−∇fc​(𝒙∗)‖2]𝔼superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓𝒙22𝔼superscriptdelimited-∥∥1𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙22𝔼superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇subscript𝑓c𝒙∇subscript𝑓csuperscript𝒙22𝔼1𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙22𝔼superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇subscript𝑓c𝒙∇subscript𝑓csuperscript𝒙22𝔼delimited-[]1𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙2superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇subscript𝑓c𝒙∇subscript𝑓csuperscript𝒙2\begin{split}\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x})\right\|^{2}&\leq 2\mathbb{E}\left\|\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\left(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{*})\right)\right\|^{2}+2\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{*})\right\|^{2}\\ &\leq 2\mathbb{E}\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\left\|\left(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{*})\right)\right\|^{2}+2\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{*})\right\|^{2}\\ &\leq 2\mathbb{E}\left[\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\left\|\left(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{*})\right)\right\|^{2}+\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{*})\right\|^{2}\right]\end{split}

Applying Proposition D.5:

𝔼​‖∇f​(𝒙)‖2≤2​𝔼​[2​β​(f​(𝒙)−f​(𝒙∗))]≤4​β​𝔼​[f​(𝒙)−f​(𝒙∗)]𝔼superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓𝒙22𝔼delimited-[]2𝛽𝑓𝒙𝑓superscript𝒙4𝛽𝔼delimited-[]𝑓𝒙𝑓superscript𝒙\begin{split}\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x})\right\|^{2}&\leq 2\mathbb{E}\left[2\beta\left(f(\bm{x})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right)\right]\\ &\leq 4\beta\mathbb{E}\left[f(\bm{x})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right]\end{split}

∎

Lemma D.7 (Perturbed strong convexity).

The following holds for any β𝛽\beta-smooth and μ𝜇\mu-strongly-convex function hℎh, and any 𝐱𝐱\bm{x}, 𝐲𝐲\bm{y}, 𝐳𝐳\bm{z} in the domain of hℎh:

⟨∇h​(𝒙),𝒛−𝒚⟩≥h​(𝒛)−h​(𝒚)+μ4​‖𝒚−𝒛‖2−β​‖𝒛−𝒙‖2∇ℎ𝒙𝒛𝒚ℎ𝒛ℎ𝒚𝜇4superscriptnorm𝒚𝒛2𝛽superscriptnorm𝒛𝒙2\left\langle\nabla h(\bm{x}),\bm{z}-\bm{y}\right\rangle\geq h(\bm{z})-h(\bm{y})+\frac{\mu}{4}\left\|\bm{y}-\bm{z}\right\|^{2}-\beta\left\|\bm{z}-\bm{x}\right\|^{2}
Proof.

Given any 𝒙𝒙\bm{x}, 𝒚𝒚\bm{y}, and 𝒛𝒛\bm{z}, we get the following two inequalities using smoothness (Definition D.1) and strong convexity (Definition D.4) of hℎh:

⟨∇h​(𝒙),𝒛−𝒙⟩≥h​(𝒛)−h​(𝒙)−β2​‖𝒛−𝒙‖2≥h​(𝒙)−h​(𝒚)+μ2​‖𝒚−𝒙‖2∇ℎ𝒙𝒛𝒙ℎ𝒛ℎ𝒙𝛽2superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝒛𝒙2ℎ𝒙ℎ𝒚𝜇2superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝒚𝒙2\begin{split}\left\langle\nabla h(\bm{x}),\bm{z}-\bm{x}\right\rangle\geq&h(\bm{z})-h(\bm{x})-\frac{\beta}{2}\left\|\bm{z}-\bm{x}\right\|^{2}\\ \geq&h(\bm{x})-h(\bm{y})+\frac{\mu}{2}\left\|\bm{y}-\bm{x}\right\|^{2}\\ \end{split}

Further, applying the relaxed triangle inequality (Lemma D.2) gives:

μ2​‖𝒚−𝒙‖2≥μ4​‖𝒚−𝒛‖2−μ2​‖𝒙−𝒛‖2𝜇2superscriptnorm𝒚𝒙2𝜇4superscriptnorm𝒚𝒛2𝜇2superscriptnorm𝒙𝒛2\frac{\mu}{2}\left\|\bm{y}-\bm{x}\right\|^{2}\geq\frac{\mu}{4}\left\|\bm{y}-\bm{z}\right\|^{2}-\frac{\mu}{2}\left\|\bm{x}-\bm{z}\right\|^{2}

Combining all the inequalities together we have:

⟨∇h​(𝒙),𝒛−𝒚⟩≥h​(𝒛)−h​(𝒚)+μ4​‖𝒚−𝒛‖2−β+μ2​‖𝒛−𝒙‖2∇ℎ𝒙𝒛𝒚ℎ𝒛ℎ𝒚𝜇4superscriptnorm𝒚𝒛2𝛽𝜇2superscriptnorm𝒛𝒙2\left\langle\nabla h(\bm{x}),\bm{z}-\bm{y}\right\rangle\geq h(\bm{z})-h(\bm{y})+\frac{\mu}{4}\left\|\bm{y}-\bm{z}\right\|^{2}-\frac{\beta+\mu}{2}\left\|\bm{z}-\bm{x}\right\|^{2}

The lemma follows since β≥μ𝛽𝜇\beta\geq\mu. ∎

Lemma D.8 (Contractive mapping).

For any β𝛽\beta-smooth and μ𝜇\mu-strongly convex function hℎh, values 𝐱𝐱\bm{x} and 𝐲𝐲\bm{y} in the domain of hℎh, and step-size (learning rate) η≤1β𝜂1𝛽\eta\leq\frac{1}{\beta}, the following holds true:

‖𝒙−η​∇h​(𝒙)−𝒚+η​∇h​(𝒚)‖2≤(1−μ​η)​‖𝒙−𝒚‖2superscriptnorm𝒙𝜂∇ℎ𝒙𝒚𝜂∇ℎ𝒚21𝜇𝜂superscriptnorm𝒙𝒚2\left\|\bm{x}-\eta\nabla h(\bm{x})-\bm{y}+\eta\nabla h(\bm{y})\right\|^{2}\leq\left(1-\mu\eta\right)\left\|\bm{x}-\bm{y}\right\|^{2}
Proof.

Expanding terms, and applying smoothness (Definition D.1):

‖𝒙−η​∇h​(𝒙)−𝒚+η​∇h​(𝒚)‖2=‖𝒙−𝒚‖2+η2​‖∇h​(𝒙)−∇h​(𝒚)‖2−2​η​⟨∇h​(𝒙)−∇h​(𝒚),𝒙−𝒚⟩≤‖𝒙−𝒚‖2+(η2​β−2​η)​⟨∇h​(𝒙)−∇h​(𝒚),𝒙−𝒚⟩formulae-sequencesuperscriptdelimited-∥∥𝒙𝜂∇ℎ𝒙𝒚𝜂∇ℎ𝒚2superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝒙𝒚2superscript𝜂2superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇ℎ𝒙∇ℎ𝒚22𝜂∇ℎ𝒙∇ℎ𝒚𝒙𝒚superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝒙𝒚2superscript𝜂2𝛽2𝜂∇ℎ𝒙∇ℎ𝒚𝒙𝒚\begin{split}\left\|\bm{x}-\eta\nabla h(\bm{x})-\bm{y}+\eta\nabla h(\bm{y})\right\|^{2}&=\left\|\bm{x}-\bm{y}\right\|^{2}+\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla h(\bm{x})-\nabla h(\bm{y})\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad\quad\quad\quad\quad\quad-2\eta\langle\nabla h(\bm{x})-\nabla h(\bm{y}),\bm{x}-\bm{y}\rangle\\ &\leq\left\|\bm{x}-\bm{y}\right\|^{2}+\left(\eta^{2}\beta-2\eta\right)\langle\nabla h(\bm{x})-\nabla h(\bm{y}),\bm{x}-\bm{y}\rangle\end{split}

If step-size is such that η≤1β𝜂1𝛽\eta\leq\frac{1}{\beta}, then:

(η2​β−2​η)​⟨∇h​(𝒙)−∇h​(𝒚),𝒙−𝒚⟩≤−η​⟨∇h​(𝒙)−∇h​(𝒚),𝒙−𝒚⟩superscript𝜂2𝛽2𝜂∇ℎ𝒙∇ℎ𝒚𝒙𝒚𝜂∇ℎ𝒙∇ℎ𝒚𝒙𝒚\left(\eta^{2}\beta-2\eta\right)\langle\nabla h(\bm{x})-\nabla h(\bm{y}),\bm{x}-\bm{y}\rangle\leq-\eta\langle\nabla h(\bm{x})-\nabla h(\bm{y}),\bm{x}-\bm{y}\rangle

Finally, for μ𝜇\mu-strong convexity (Definition D.4) of hℎh we have:

−η​⟨∇h​(𝒙)−∇h​(𝒚),𝒙−𝒚⟩≤−μ​η​‖𝒙−𝒚‖2𝜂∇ℎ𝒙∇ℎ𝒚𝒙𝒚𝜇𝜂superscriptnorm𝒙𝒚2-\eta\langle\nabla h(\bm{x})-\nabla h(\bm{y}),\bm{x}-\bm{y}\rangle\leq-\mu\eta\left\|\bm{x}-\bm{y}\right\|^{2}

∎

D.2 Proofs of Theorem B.2

We will now prove the rates of convergence stated in Theorem B.2 for 1-way Gradient Transfer. Subsection D.2.1 proves the convergence rates for strongly convex and general convex cases, and Subsection D.2.2 proves the convergence rates for the non-convex case.

Let S𝑆S be the cardinality of the cohort of clients 𝒮𝒮\mathcal{S} participating in a round of training. Let the server and client optimizers be SGD. Let the clients all take an equal number of steps K𝐾K, and let η~~𝜂\tilde{\eta} be the ‘effective step-size’, equal to K​ηs​η𝐾subscript𝜂s𝜂K\eta_{\textrm{s}}\eta. With 1-way Gradient Transfer, the server update of the global model at round t𝑡t can be written as:

𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)=−η~K​S​∑i∈𝒮∑k=1K(gi​(𝒙i(t,k))+gc​(𝒙(t)))𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)=−η~​gc​(𝒙(t))−η~K​S​∑i∈𝒮∑k=1K(gi​(𝒙i(t,k)))superscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝒙𝑡~𝜂𝐾𝑆subscript𝑖𝒮superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝑔𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑖𝑡𝑘subscript𝑔csuperscript𝒙𝑡superscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝒙𝑡~𝜂subscript𝑔csuperscript𝒙𝑡~𝜂𝐾𝑆subscript𝑖𝒮superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝑔𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑖𝑡𝑘\begin{split}\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}&=-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{KS}\sum_{i\in{\mathcal{S}}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\\ \bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}&=-\tilde{\eta}g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{KS}\sum_{i\in{\mathcal{S}}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})\right)\end{split} (11)

Henceforth, let 𝔼|t​[⋅]\mathbb{E}_{|t}[\cdot] denote expectation conditioned on 𝒙(t)superscript𝒙𝑡\bm{x}^{(t)}. As in Karimireddy et al. [2020b], we’ll define a client local ‘drift’ term in round t𝑡t as:

ℰ(t)=1K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k)−𝒙(t)‖2\mathcal{E}^{(t)}=\frac{1}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2} (12)
Lemma D.9 (Bound on variance of server update).

The variance of the server update is bounded as:

𝔼|t​[‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2]≤4​η~2​β2​ℰ(t)+2​η~2​(2K​S​σ2+σc2)+2​η~2​𝔼|t​[‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2]\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\right]\leq 4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\beta^{2}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\right]
Proof.

Let 𝒮𝒮{\mathcal{S}} denote the set of clients sampled in round t𝑡t. For brevity, we will use Δ​𝒙Δ𝒙\Delta\bm{x} to refer to 𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)superscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝒙𝑡\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}.

𝔼|t​‖Δ​𝒙‖2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\Delta\bm{x}\right\|^{2} =𝔼|t​[‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2]\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\right]
=𝔼|t​[‖η~K​S​∑i∈𝒮∑k=1K(gi​(𝒙i(t,k))+gc​(𝒙(t)))‖2]\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{KS}\sum_{i\in{\mathcal{S}}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\right\|^{2}\right]
≤𝔼|t​[‖η~K​S​∑i∈𝒮∑k=1K(gi​(𝒙i(t,k))−∇ff​(𝒙(t)))+(∇ff​(𝒙(t))+gc​(𝒙(t)))‖2]\displaystyle\leq\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{KS}\sum_{i\in{\mathcal{S}}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})-\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)+\left(\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\right\|^{2}\right]

We separate terms by applying the relaxed triangle inequality (Lemma D.2):

𝔼|t​‖Δ​𝒙‖2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\Delta\bm{x}\right\|^{2} ≤2​η~2​𝔼|t​[‖1K​S​∑i∈𝒮∑k=1K(gi​(𝒙i(t,k))−∇ff​(𝒙(t)))‖2]⏟𝒜+2​η~2​𝔼|t​[‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+gc​(𝒙(t))‖2]⏟ℬ\displaystyle\leq\underbrace{2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i\in{\mathcal{S}}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})-\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\right\|^{2}\right]}_{\text{$\mathcal{A}$}}+\underbrace{2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\right]}_{\text{$\mathcal{B}$}}

In term 𝒜𝒜\mathcal{A}, we separate mean and variance for the client stochastic gradients gisubscript𝑔𝑖g_{i}, using Lemma D.3 and Equation 4:

𝒜𝒜\displaystyle\mathcal{A} ≤4​η~2​𝔼|t​[‖1K​S​∑i∈𝒮∑k=1K(∇ff​(𝒙i(t,k))−∇ff​(𝒙(t)))‖2]+4​η~2​σ2K​S\displaystyle\leq 4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i\in{\mathcal{S}}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})-\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\right\|^{2}\right]+\frac{4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma^{2}}{KS}

We apply the relaxed triangle inequality (Lemma D.2) followed by smoothness (Definition D.1), to convert it to an expression in terms of drift ℰ(t)superscriptℰ𝑡\mathcal{E}^{(t)}:

𝒜𝒜\displaystyle\mathcal{A} ≤4​η~2K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K𝔼|t​[‖∇ff​(𝒙i(t,k))−∇ff​(𝒙(t))‖2]+4​η~2​σ2K​S\displaystyle\leq\frac{4\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})-\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\right]+\frac{4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma^{2}}{KS}
≤4​η~2​β2K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K𝔼|t​[‖𝒙i(t,k)−𝒙(t)‖2]+4​η~2​σ2K​S\displaystyle\leq\frac{4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\beta^{2}}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\right]+\frac{4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma^{2}}{KS}
≤4​η~2​β2​ℰ(t)+4​η~2​σ2K​Sabsent4superscript~𝜂2superscript𝛽2superscriptℰ𝑡4superscript~𝜂2superscript𝜎2𝐾𝑆\displaystyle\leq 4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\beta^{2}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}+\frac{4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma^{2}}{KS}

In term ℬℬ\mathcal{B} we have a full gradient of the federated loss ∇ff∇subscript𝑓f\nabla f_{\textrm{f}} and a stochastic gradient of the centralized loss gcsubscript𝑔cg_{\textrm{c}}. We use Lemma D.3 to separate the stochastic gradient into a full gradient of the centralized loss ∇fc∇subscript𝑓c\nabla f_{\textrm{c}} and a variance term, allowing us to express in terms of full gradient of the overall loss ∇f∇𝑓\nabla f.

ℬℬ\displaystyle\mathcal{B} =2​η~2​𝔼|t​[‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+gc​(𝒙(t))‖2]\displaystyle=2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\right]
≤2​η~2​𝔼|t​[‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+∇fc​(𝒙(t))‖2]+2​η~2​σc2\displaystyle\leq 2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\right]+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}
≤2​η~2​𝔼|t​[‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2]+2​η~2​σc2\displaystyle\leq 2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\right]+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}

Combining 𝒜𝒜\mathcal{A} and ℬℬ\mathcal{B} back together:

𝔼|t​‖Δ​𝒙‖2≤4​η~2​β2​ℰ(t)+2​η~2​(2K​S​σ2+σc2)+2​η~2​𝔼|t​[‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2]\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\Delta\bm{x}\right\|^{2}\leq 4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\beta^{2}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\right]

∎

D.2.1 Convex Cases

We will state two lemmas, one (Lemma D.10) related to the progress in round t𝑡t towards reaching 𝒙∗superscript𝒙\bm{x}^{*}, and the other (Lemma D.11) bounding the federated clients ‘drift’ in round t𝑡t, ℰ(t)superscriptℰ𝑡\mathcal{E}^{(t)}. We then combine the two lemmas together to give the proofs of convergence rate for the strongly convex (μ>0𝜇0\mu>0) and general convex (μ=0𝜇0\mu=0) cases.

Lemma D.10 (One round progress).

Suppose our functions satisfy bounded variance σ2superscript𝜎2\sigma^{2}, μ𝜇\mu-convexity (Definition D.4), and β𝛽\beta-smoothness (Definition D.1). If η~<18​β~𝜂18𝛽\tilde{\eta}<\frac{1}{8\beta}, the updates of 1-way Gradient Transfer satisfy:

𝔼|t​[‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙∗‖2]≤(1−3​μ​η~2)​‖𝒙(t)−𝒙∗‖2−η~​(f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗))+516​ℰ(t)+2​η~2​(2K​S​σ2+σc2)\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{*}\right\|^{2}\right]&\leq\left(1-\frac{3\mu\tilde{\eta}}{2}\right)\left\|\bm{x}^{(t)}-\bm{x}^{*}\right\|^{2}-\tilde{\eta}\left(f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right)+\frac{5}{16}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\end{split}
Proof.

The expected server update, with N𝑁N total clients in the federated population, is:

𝔼​[𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)]=−η~​𝔼​[gc​(𝒙(t))]−η~K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K𝔼​[gi​(𝒙i(t,k))]𝔼delimited-[]superscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝒙𝑡~𝜂𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝑔csuperscript𝒙𝑡~𝜂𝐾𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾𝔼delimited-[]subscript𝑔𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒙𝑖𝑡𝑘\mathbb{E}\left[\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right]=-\tilde{\eta}\mathbb{E}\left[g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right]-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\mathbb{E}\left[g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})\right]

Lemma D.11 (Bounded drift).

Suppose our functions satisfy bounded variance, μ𝜇\mu-convexity (Definition D.4), and β𝛽\beta-smoothness (Definition D.1). Then the drift is bounded as:

ℰ(t)≤12​K2​η2​β​𝔼​[f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗)]+3​K2​η2​(1K​σ2+σc2)superscriptℰ𝑡12superscript𝐾2superscript𝜂2𝛽𝔼delimited-[]𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡𝑓superscript𝒙3superscript𝐾2superscript𝜂21𝐾superscript𝜎2superscriptsubscript𝜎c2\mathcal{E}^{(t)}\leq 12K^{2}\eta^{2}\beta\mathbb{E}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right]+3K^{2}\eta^{2}\left(\frac{1}{K}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)
Proof.

We begin with the summand of the drift term, looking at the drift of a particular client i𝑖i at local step k𝑘k. Expanding this summand out:

𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k)−𝒙(t)‖2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2} =𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k−1)−η​(gi​(𝒙i(t,k−1))+gc​(𝒙(t)))−𝒙(t)‖2\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)}-\eta\left(g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}
=𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k−1)−𝒙(t)−η​gi​(𝒙i(t,k−1))−η​gc​(𝒙(t))‖2.\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}-\eta g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)})-\eta g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}.

Separating mean and variance of the client gradient, then using the relaxed triangle inequality (Lemma D.2) to further separate out terms:

𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k)−𝒙(t)‖2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2} ≤𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k−1)−𝒙(t)−η​∇ff​(𝒙i(t,k−1))−η​gc​(𝒙(t))‖2+η2​σ2\displaystyle\leq\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}-\eta\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)})-\eta g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
≤(1+1a)​𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k−1)−𝒙(t)−η​(∇ff​(𝒙i(t,k−1))−∇ff​(𝒙(t)))‖2⏟ℱ\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{a}\right)\underbrace{\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}-\eta\left(\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)})-\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\right\|^{2}}_{\text{$\mathcal{F}$}}
+(1+a)​η2​‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+gc​(𝒙(t))‖2+η2​σ2.1𝑎superscript𝜂2superscriptnorm∇subscript𝑓fsuperscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑔csuperscript𝒙𝑡2superscript𝜂2superscript𝜎2\displaystyle\quad\quad\quad+\left(1+a\right)\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}.

Term ℱℱ\mathcal{F} is bounded via the contractive mapping lemma (Lemma D.8), provided that η≤1β𝜂1𝛽\eta\leq\frac{1}{\beta}:

ℱℱ\displaystyle\mathcal{F} ≤(1−μ​η)​𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k−1)−𝒙(t)‖2≤𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k−1)−𝒙(t)‖2.\displaystyle\leq(1-\mu\eta)\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\leq\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}.

Putting back into the bound on drift on client i𝑖i at local step k𝑘k, and letting a=K𝑎𝐾a=K:

𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k)−𝒙(t)‖2≤K+1K​𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k−1)−𝒙(t)‖2+2​K​η2​‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+gc​(𝒙(t))‖2+η2​σ2.\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\leq\tfrac{K+1}{K}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k-1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}+2K\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}.

Unrolling the recursion:

𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k)−𝒙(t)‖2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2} ≤(2​K​η2​‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+gc​(𝒙(t))‖2+η2​σ2)​∑j=0k−1(K+1K)jabsent2𝐾superscript𝜂2superscriptnorm∇subscript𝑓fsuperscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑔csuperscript𝒙𝑡2superscript𝜂2superscript𝜎2superscriptsubscript𝑗0𝑘1superscript𝐾1𝐾𝑗\displaystyle\leq\left(2K\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\right)\sum_{j=0}^{k-1}\left(\tfrac{K+1}{K}\right)^{j}
≤(2​K​η2​‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+gc​(𝒙(t))‖2+η2​σ2)​(2​K)absent2𝐾superscript𝜂2superscriptnorm∇subscript𝑓fsuperscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑔csuperscript𝒙𝑡2superscript𝜂2superscript𝜎22𝐾\displaystyle\leq\left(2K\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\right)\left(2K\right)
≤4​K2​η2​‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+gc​(𝒙(t))‖2+2​K​η2​σ2.absent4superscript𝐾2superscript𝜂2superscriptnorm∇subscript𝑓fsuperscript𝒙𝑡subscript𝑔csuperscript𝒙𝑡22𝐾superscript𝜂2superscript𝜎2\displaystyle\leq 4K^{2}\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+2K\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}.

The second inequality above uses the following bound:

∑j=0k−1(K+1K)j​((1+1K)k−1)=K≤(e−1)​K≤2​K.superscriptsubscript𝑗0𝑘1superscript𝐾1𝐾𝑗superscript11𝐾𝑘1𝐾𝑒1𝐾2𝐾\sum_{j=0}^{k-1}\left(\tfrac{K+1}{K}\right)^{j}((1+\tfrac{1}{K})^{k}-1)=K\leq(e-1)K\leq 2K.

Now separating mean and variance of the central gradient:

𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k)−𝒙(t)‖2≤4​K2​η2​‖∇ff​(𝒙(t))+∇fc​(𝒙(t))‖2+2​K2​η2​σc2+2​K​η2​σ2≤4​K2​η2​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+2​K2​η2​(1K​σ2+σc2).\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}&\leq 4K^{2}\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})+\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+2K^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}+2K\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\\ &\leq 4K^{2}\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+2K^{2}\eta^{2}\left(\frac{1}{K}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right).\end{split}

Finally, we apply Proposition D.6:

ℰ(t)≤4​K2​η2​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+2​K2​η2​(1K​σ2+σc2)≤16​K2​η2​β​𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗)]+2​K2​η2​(1K​σ2+σc2).\begin{split}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}&\leq 4K^{2}\eta^{2}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+2K^{2}\eta^{2}\left(\frac{1}{K}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\\ &\leq 16K^{2}\eta^{2}\beta\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right]+2K^{2}\eta^{2}\left(\frac{1}{K}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right).\end{split}

Assuming that η~≤18​β~𝜂18𝛽\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{8\beta}:

ℰ(t)≤2​η~ηs2​𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗)]+2​η~2ηs2​(1K​σ2+σc2)\mathcal{E}^{(t)}\leq 2\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right]+2\frac{\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\left(\frac{1}{K}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\\

∎

Proofs of Theorem B.2 for Convex Cases

Adding the statements of Lemmas D.10 and D.11, and assuming that ηs>58​Ssubscript𝜂s58𝑆\eta_{\textrm{s}}>\sqrt{\frac{5}{8}S}, η=18​β​K​ηs𝜂18𝛽𝐾subscript𝜂s\eta=\frac{1}{8\beta K\eta_{\textrm{s}}} so that η~=18​β~𝜂18𝛽\tilde{\eta}=\frac{1}{8\beta}, we get:

𝔼|t​[‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙∗‖2]≤(1−3​μ​η~2)​‖𝒙(t)−𝒙∗‖2−η~​(f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗))+516​(2​η~ηs2​𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗)]+2​η~2ηs2​(1K​σ2+σc2))+2​η~2​(2K​S​σ2+σc2)=(1−3​μ​η~2)​‖𝒙(t)−𝒙∗‖2−η~​(f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗))+58​η~ηs2​𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗)]+(58​η~2K​ηs2+4​η~2K​S)​σ2+(58​η~2ηs2+2​η~2)​σc2≤(1−3​μ​η~2)​‖𝒙(t)−𝒙∗‖2−(S−1S)​η~​𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t))−f​(𝒙∗)]+(5​σ2K​S+3​σc2)​η~2.\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{*}\right\|^{2}\right]&\leq\left(1-\frac{3\mu\tilde{\eta}}{2}\right)\left\|\bm{x}^{(t)}-\bm{x}^{*}\right\|^{2}-\tilde{\eta}\left(f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right)\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{5}{16}\left(2\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right]+2\frac{\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\left(\frac{1}{K}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\right)\\ &\quad\quad\quad+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\\ &=\left(1-\frac{3\mu\tilde{\eta}}{2}\right)\left\|\bm{x}^{(t)}-\bm{x}^{*}\right\|^{2}-\tilde{\eta}\left(f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right)\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{5}{8}\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right]\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\left(\frac{5}{8}\frac{\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{K\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}+4\frac{\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{KS}\right)\sigma^{2}+\left(\frac{5}{8}\frac{\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\right)\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\\ &\leq\left(1-\frac{3\mu\tilde{\eta}}{2}\right)\left\|\bm{x}^{(t)}-\bm{x}^{*}\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad-\left(\frac{S-1}{S}\right)\tilde{\eta}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-f(\bm{x}^{*})\right]+\left(\frac{5\sigma^{2}}{KS}+3\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\tilde{\eta}^{2}.\end{split}

We can now remove the conditioning over 𝒙(t)superscript𝒙𝑡\bm{x}^{(t)} by taking an expectation on both sides over 𝒙(t)superscript𝒙𝑡\bm{x}^{(t)}, to get a recurrence relation of the same form.

For the case of strong convexity (μ>0𝜇0\mu>0), we can use lemmas (e.g., Lemma 1 in Karimireddy et al. [2020b], Lemma 2 in Stich [2019]) which establish a linear convergence rate for such recursions. In the above expression, D2superscript𝐷2D^{2} is a distance in parameter space at initialization, ‖𝒙(0)−𝒙∗‖2superscriptnormsuperscript𝒙0superscript𝒙2\left\|\bm{x}^{(0)}-\bm{x}^{*}\right\|^{2}.

D.2.2 Non-Convex Case

We will now prove the rate of convergence stated in Theorem B.2 for the non-convex case for 1-way Gradient Transfer. We will state two lemmas, one (Lemma D.12) establishing the progress made in each round, and one (Lemma D.13) bounding how much the federated clients ‘drift’ in a round during the course of local training. We then combine the two lemmas together give the proof of convergence rate for the non-convex case.

Lemma D.12 (Non-convex one round progress).

The progress made in a round can be bounded as:

𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t+1))]≤f​(𝒙(t))−4​η~9​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+β27​ℰ(t)+(2K​S​σ2+σc2)​β​η~2\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)})\right]\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{4\tilde{\eta}}{9}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\frac{\beta}{27}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}+\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\beta\tilde{\eta}^{2}
Proof.

We begin by using the smoothness of f𝑓f to get the following bound on the expectation of f​(𝒙(t+1))𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)}) conditioned on 𝒙(t)superscript𝒙𝑡\bm{x}^{(t)}:

𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t+1))]≤𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t))+⟨∇f​(𝒙(t)),𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)⟩+β2​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2]≤f​(𝒙(t))+𝔼|t​⟨∇f​(𝒙(t)),𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)⟩+β2​𝔼|t​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2.\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)})\right]&\leq\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t)})+\left\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)}),\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\rangle+\frac{\beta}{2}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\right]\\ &\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})+\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)}),\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\rangle+\frac{\beta}{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}.\end{split}

Substituting in the definition of the 1-way Gradient Transfer server update (Equation 11), and using Assumption 4.1 for the expectation of the client stochastic gradient:

𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t+1))]≤f​(𝒙(t))+𝔼|t​⟨∇f​(𝒙(t)),−η~K​S​∑i∈𝒮∑k=1K(gi​(𝒙i(t,k))+gc​(𝒙(t)))⟩+β2​𝔼|t​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2≤f​(𝒙(t))−η~​⟨∇f​(𝒙(t)),1K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K(∇ff​(𝒙i(t,k))+∇fc​(𝒙(t)))⟩+β2​𝔼|t​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2.\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)})\right]&\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})+\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)}),-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{KS}\sum_{i\in{\mathcal{S}}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(g_{i}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})+g_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\right\rangle\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\beta}{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\\ &\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\tilde{\eta}\left\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)}),\frac{1}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})+\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\right\rangle\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\beta}{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}.\end{split}

Next, we make use of the fact that −a​b=12​((b−a)2−a2−b2)≤−12​a2+12​(b−a)2𝑎𝑏12superscript𝑏𝑎2superscript𝑎2superscript𝑏212superscript𝑎212superscript𝑏𝑎2-ab=\frac{1}{2}((b-a)^{2}-a^{2}-b^{2})\leq-\frac{1}{2}a^{2}+\frac{1}{2}(b-a)^{2}:

𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t+1))]≤f​(𝒙(t))−η~2​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+η~2​‖1K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K(∇ff​(𝒙i(t,k))+∇fc​(𝒙(t)))−∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+β2​𝔼|t​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2≤f​(𝒙(t))−η~2​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+η~2​‖1K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K(∇ff​(𝒙i(t,k))−∇ff​(𝒙(t)))‖2+β2​𝔼|t​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2≤f​(𝒙(t))−η~2​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+η~2​1K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K𝔼|t​‖∇ff​(𝒙i(t,k))−∇ff​(𝒙(t))‖2+β2​𝔼|t​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2.\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)})\right]&\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\left\|\frac{1}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})+\nabla f_{\textrm{c}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\beta}{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\\ &\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\left\|\frac{1}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})-\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right)\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\beta}{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\\ &\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\frac{1}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)})-\nabla f_{\textrm{f}}(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\beta}{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}.\end{split}

Next, we use smoothness (Definition D.1), and the definition of client drift (Equation 12):

𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t+1))]≤f​(𝒙(t))−η~2​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+η~​β22​1K​N​∑i=1N∑k=1K𝔼|t​‖𝒙i(t,k)−𝒙(t)‖2+β2​𝔼|t​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2≤f​(𝒙(t))−η~2​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+η~​β22​ℰ(t)+β2​𝔼|t​‖𝒙(t+1)−𝒙(t)‖2.\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)})\right]&\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\beta^{2}}{2}\frac{1}{KN}\sum_{i=1}^{N}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}_{i}^{(t,k)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\beta}{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}\\ &\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\beta^{2}}{2}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\beta}{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\bm{x}^{(t+1)}-\bm{x}^{(t)}\right\|^{2}.\end{split}

The last term is the variance of the server update, for which we can substitute the bound from Lemma D.9:

𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t+1))]≤f​(𝒙(t))−η~2​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+η~​β22​ℰ(t)+β2​(4​η~2​β2​ℰ(t)+2​η~2​(2K​S​σ2+σc2)+2​η~2​𝔼|t​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2)≤f​(𝒙(t))−(η~2−β​η~2)​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+(η~​β22+2​η~2​β3)​ℰ(t)+η~2​β​(2K​S​σ2+σc2).\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)})\right]&\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\beta^{2}}{2}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\frac{\beta}{2}\left(4\tilde{\eta}^{2}\beta^{2}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\right)\\ &\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}-\beta\tilde{\eta}^{2}\right)\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}\beta^{2}}{2}+2\tilde{\eta}^{2}\beta^{3}\right)\mathcal{E}^{(t)}\\ &\quad\quad\quad+\tilde{\eta}^{2}\beta\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right).\end{split}

Assuming a bound on effective step-size η~≤118​β~𝜂118𝛽\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{18\beta}:

𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t+1))]≤f​(𝒙(t))−4​η~9​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+β27​ℰ(t)+(2K​S​σ2+σc2)​β​η~2.\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)})\right]\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{4\tilde{\eta}}{9}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\frac{\beta}{27}\mathcal{E}^{(t)}+\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\beta\tilde{\eta}^{2}.

∎

Lemma D.13 (Non-convex bounded drift).

Suppose our functions satisfy bounded variance and β𝛽\beta-smoothness (Definition D.1). Then the drift is bounded as:

ℰ(t)≤4​η~9​β​ηs2​𝔼​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+2​η~2ηs2​(1K​σ2+4​σc2).superscriptℰ𝑡4~𝜂9𝛽superscriptsubscript𝜂s2𝔼superscriptnorm∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡22superscript~𝜂2superscriptsubscript𝜂s21𝐾superscript𝜎24superscriptsubscript𝜎c2\mathcal{E}^{(t)}\leq\frac{4\tilde{\eta}}{9\beta\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\frac{2\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\left(\frac{1}{K}\sigma^{2}+4\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right).
Proof.

Proofs of Theorem B.2 for Non-Convex Case

Adding the statements of Lemmas D.12 and D.13, and assuming ηs≥Ssubscript𝜂s𝑆\eta_{\textrm{s}}\geq\sqrt{S}, we get:

𝔼|t​[f​(𝒙(t+1))]≤f​(𝒙(t))−4​η~9​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+(2K​S​σ2+σc2)​β​η~2+β27​(4​η~9​β​ηs2​𝔼​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+2​η~2ηs2​(1K​σ2+4​σc2))≤f​(𝒙(t))−13​η~​‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2+(3K​S​σ2+2​σc2)​β​η~2\begin{split}\mathbb{E}_{|t}\left[f(\bm{x}^{(t+1)})\right]&\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{4\tilde{\eta}}{9}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\left(\frac{2}{KS}\sigma^{2}+\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\beta\tilde{\eta}^{2}\\ &\quad+\frac{\beta}{27}\left(\frac{4\tilde{\eta}}{9\beta\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\mathbb{E}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\frac{2\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{\eta_{\textrm{s}}^{2}}\left(\frac{1}{K}\sigma^{2}+4\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\right)\\ &\leq f(\bm{x}^{(t)})-\frac{1}{3}\tilde{\eta}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}+\left(\frac{3}{KS}\sigma^{2}+2\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\beta\tilde{\eta}^{2}\\ \end{split}

With the above, we have a recursive bound on the loss after round t+1𝑡1t+1. We can use lemmas (e.g., Lemma 2 in Karimireddy et al. [2020b], Lemma 4 in Stich [2019]) which establish a sub-linear convergence rate for such recursions. Assuming η~≤118​β~𝜂118𝛽\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{18\beta} and ηs≥Ssubscript𝜂s𝑆\eta_{\textrm{s}}\geq\sqrt{S}, we get:

mint∈{1,2,…,T+1}⁡‖∇f​(𝒙(t))‖2≤54​β​FT+1+6​(3K​S​σ2+2​σc2)​β​FT+1.subscript𝑡12…𝑇1superscriptnorm∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡254𝛽𝐹𝑇163𝐾𝑆superscript𝜎22superscriptsubscript𝜎c2𝛽𝐹𝑇1\min_{t\in\{1,2,\ldots,T+1\}}\left\|\nabla f(\bm{x}^{(t)})\right\|^{2}\leq\frac{54\beta F}{T+1}+\frac{6\sqrt{\left(\frac{3}{KS}\sigma^{2}+2\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\beta F}}{\sqrt{T+1}}.

In the above expressions, F𝐹F is the error at initialization, f​(𝒙(0))−f​(𝒙∗)𝑓superscript𝒙0𝑓superscript𝒙f(\bm{x}^{(0)})-f(\bm{x}^{*}).

This yields an expression for the number of rounds T𝑇T to reach an error ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilon:

T=𝒪​((σ2+K​S​σc2)​β​FK​S​ϵ2+β​Fϵ).𝑇𝒪superscript𝜎2𝐾𝑆superscriptsubscript𝜎c2𝛽𝐹𝐾𝑆superscriptitalic-ϵ2𝛽𝐹italic-ϵT=\mathcal{O}\left(\frac{\left(\sigma^{2}+KS\sigma_{\textrm{c}}^{2}\right)\beta F}{KS\epsilon^{2}}+\frac{\beta F}{\epsilon}\right).
